intro: Furcraea gigantea var. mediopicta, commonly known as the Variegated Furcraea, is a striking ornamental plant native to Central America. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sword-shaped leaves that are often variegated with white and green patterns. The plant is evergreen and can grow up to several meters in height, making it a dramatic addition to gardens or indoor spaces. It thrives in warm, sunny conditions and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
